Ceasar Shift Cipher

by Caleb Anderson

This app, written in JavaScript, simulates a similar encryption cipher that was used by Julius Caesar and is believed to be the first documented use of cryptography for military purposes.

Learn more:

  • The Code Book: The Science of Secrecy from Ancient Egypt to Quantum Cryptography by Simon Singh
  • https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caesar_cipher
  • C++ version

Enter a key (1-25) to left shift the plain alphabet by n positions. Then, enter a message to encrypt using the new cipher alphabet. Check the decrypt box to decipher a message using the specified key.

ðŸ”¥ A key of 13, is of course, effectively, ROT-13.

Privacy note: all data interoperations are done on your local computer. Nothing in these input fields are sent to the server.
